channel.title: Half a smoke
channel.description: Recent content on Half a smoke

item.title: # enough to fill a man's heart
item.description: - A young man who always feels he doesn’t belong, every where he went, he felt a sense of disconnect, disconnect with his surrounding, his people, sometimes his mind as if he hungry for a place of his own, his own trees howling in the wind, his own moon’s reflection on a quiet lake, his own sun circling around him..his own people. Everyday he counts his steps while walking to the four walls of contentment, missed one step he thought but it’s matter not as he unlocking the door.

item.title: # key, room and memories
item.description: - everyday she is granted a key to a room she went in one time she was so happy and didn’t want to leave one time she couldn’t move even a finger upon entering one time she was so frightened by all the pictures hanged on the wall one time she just smiled and left one time she didn’t enter any room, she sat down and looked, looked around, looked inward, inside of her and suddenly around her was filled with…

item.title: # knowing
item.description: - All this time in my head there was a question, one question can turn everything seems joyful into gloomy, cleverness into sadness and happiness into despair. I long for an answer, a direction, or simply a guideline to set out… as you may guess, I found it, found the answer, THE answer that is, my effort, my attempt, my endeavor was less than the meaningless and the nothingness itself.

item.title: # the last stranger
# man in search
item.description: - man searching for his soul “who leaves can never return and for those who stay will receive eternal joy” that was what he saw at the door when he’s pondering on his decision whether to stay or to leave “to fill, must, to break” he heard that long ago from an old man and that night, he couldn’t sleep, he was thinking but he couldn’t say anything, to her

item.title: # story of a man
item.description: - let me tell you a story about a man every night he shuts his eyes, he saw himself standing in a room, a space, an area, whatever but there is nothing but himself and every time he’s in there, he was forced to play… he played his memories back and forth he played those pictures as a movie he played those words as a sentence he played those tunes as a song

item.title: # silence
item.description: - I’m in a room, that unforgettable room lighted a cigarette and they’re coming at me, good and bad it’s ok, I want them to pieces of broken vase, by accident, floating and scratching the air “…don’t be sorry” opening a window, too much smoke sitting up there, contemplating all the noise, TV, fans, bikes down the street, birds in a room…? but I can only hear the silence between them

item.title: # fun Souls
item.description: - In a world where Fire is fundamental… Thereâ€™s a man, the chosen one they called him, carrying out a task… an old prophecy. â€œ…maketh pilgrimage to the land of Ancient Lordsâ€¦ â€¦When thou ringeth the Bell of Awakening, fate, thou shalt know…â€ Set foot into the land of Ancient lords whose throne forsaken and slowly fall into obscurity. Encountered countless decaying skeletons, senseless undeads, horrendous monsters, even dragons. Fought them all.

item.title: # self-fulfilling prophecy
item.description: - close my eyes i feel my head hurt, then it stop i hear my heart pounding, non-stop i smell a familiar scent but i see nothing, bleak black for i walked into the abyss alone like everyone else but… with nothing in hands and barefooted returned but the man who walked in was never return no one ever return the same it got something of us all it got something

item.title: # the abyss - 1st attemp
item.description: - the greatest challenge of all is not to overcome obstacles or running through some milestones it is to face oneself in the nothingness, the abyss, to look inward within oneself, to dive deep, to search for what lies underneath not just the tip of the iceberg because… the abyss is all around us suppose one day you’re happily strolling in the street or mistakenly counting your steps on a drunken night out

item.title: # Force Positivity
item.description: - I struggle with happiness.. I think we all do.. and I don’t think a lot of people talk about it because… There’s no in between! I think it’s either you’re happy or you’re depressed! But what if you’re just fine? There’s times where I feel really happy but at that time I also know this is temporary and I’m gonna go back to just fine. And there’s times where I feel unhappy and I know it’s gonna go back to normal.

item.title: About me
item.description: collection of thoughts, sometimes quote passages from reading accustomed ordinary in oneâ€™s mind
